Package com.cafean.CalcServer

Class CalcServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.CalcServer.CalcServer
  • public class CalcServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Main application class of the SNAP Calculation Server.

    • Field Detail

      • instance

        public static CalcServer instance
        The static instance of this class.

      • ready

        public static boolean ready
        Flag to indicate application has completed initialization.

      • debug_level

        public static java.lang.Integer debug_level
        The debug level used to control the amount of information written to the log file.

      • CONFIG_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.io.File CONFIG_DIRECTORY
        The absolute location of the current user's ~/.snap/ directory

      • LOG_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.io.File LOG_DIRECTORY
        The absolute location of the current user's ~/.snap/ directory

      • FILE_SHUTDOWN

        public static final java.io.File FILE_SHUTDOWN
        The absolute file location of the shutdown file. The presence of this file indicates to a currently running calculation server that the shutdown process should begin.

      • FILE_REFRESH

        public static final java.io.File FILE_REFRESH
        The absolute file location of the config refresh file. The presence of this file indicates to a currently running calculation server that the SNAP properties file should be re-read and the runtime configuration refreshed.

      • FILE_PORTFILE

        public static final java.io.File FILE_PORTFILE
        The absolute file location of the calculation server port file. The currently open server port is written to this file just after it is open to allow local clients to connect directly without having previous knowledge of the configured port.

      • FILE_STATFILE

        public static final java.io.File FILE_STATFILE
        The absolute file location of the calculation server status file. The server will touch this file periodically to indicate that the server is active.

    • Method Detail

      • getInteractiveCalcPort

        public static int getInteractiveCalcPort()
        returns the port used by this calculation server for communication with submitted interactive jobs.

      • logM

        public void logM​(java.lang.String user,
                 java.lang.String mess)
        Write a time stamped message to the log file.
        Parameters:
        user - The userid of the connection that originated the message.
        mess - The message string to write to the file.

      • logM

        public void logM​(int dbgLevel,
                 java.lang.String user,
                 java.lang.String mess,
                 java.lang.Throwable ex)
        Write a time stamped Exception Stack Trace to the log file.
        Parameters:
        user - The userid of the connection that originated the message.
        mess - The message string to write to the file before the exception.
        ex - The Exception to write to the file.

      • logM

        public void logM​(int dbgLevel,
                 java.lang.String mess,
                 java.lang.Throwable ex)
        Write a time stamped Exception Stack Trace to the log file.
        Parameters:
        dbgLevel - The debug level for the message and exception.
        mess - The message string to write to the file before the exception.
        ex - The Exception to write to the file.

      • getLocationByFolder

        public static java.io.File getLocationByFolder​(java.lang.String folderPath)
        returns the file-system location for the given root-folder anchored path.

        Note that this method does not check for the existence the folders in the given path beyond the root folder.

        Parameters:
        folderPath - a String containing the absolute path to a folder starting with a root folder in the form: /root/subdir1/subdir2
        Returns:
        a File referring to the file-system location or null if the root folder given does not exist.

      • getFolderPathByLoc

        public static java.lang.String getFolderPathByLoc​(java.io.File location)
        Returns the root-folder anchored path that contains the given file-system location. The returned path will have a trailing '/' for folders and no trailing '/' for files.
        Returns:
        a String containing the folder path to the given location or null if the location cannot be found.

      • findJobByFolderPath

        public static CalcJobFile findJobByFolderPath​(java.lang.String folderPath)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to load the CJF for the job at the given location.
        Returns:
        the CalcJobFile requested. This method does not return null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the CJF is not found or is not in CJF format.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the URL format is unsupported.

      • getJobQueue

        public final JobQueue getJobQueue()
